thread.title: In full: Nick Clegg Newsnight interview
thread.title_full: In full: Nick Clegg Newsnight interview - BBC News

author: BBC
title: In full: Nick Clegg Newsnight interview
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device In full: Nick Clegg Newsnight interview 14 October 2015 Last updated at 11:53 BST
The former Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg says the EU referendum is likely to be "jolly close".
Speaking in an interview with BBC Newsnight's Evan Davis, the former leader of the Liberal Democrats said the UK's relationship with the United States would be "significantly weakened" if the country votes to leave.
Mr Clegg joked that his biggest regret may have been "sitting mute" next to David Cameron during Prime Minister's Questions, as this gave the false impression the Liberal Democrats were "passengers" rather than "architects" in government.
